alert.note: Alert for Monroe (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 03 at 10:04PM CST until March 05 at 4:12AM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Mississippi... Tombigbee River near Amory affecting Monroe County. For the Tombigbee River...including Amory...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tombigbee River near Amory. * WHEN...Until early Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 22.0 feet, Lowland near the river is flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 PM CST Friday the stage was 21.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:15 PM CST Friday was 25.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 21.5 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 21.6 feet on 08/07/2003. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Saturday morning at 1015 AM CST.
